description: unique identification label gave to each specimen by collector, consist of leters and number. Letters indicate initial of species scientific name, may be wrong due to wrong label made in field. Numbers refers to number of total specimens for the species collected by the point.
unique string ranges from 1 to 15, indicates corresponding pair number of the specimen
it indicates whether the specimen is used for burn trial or not. 'b' means the specimen is used for burn trial, 'u' means the specimen isn't used for burn trial
USDA species code
fresh mass weight of paried specimen
oven-dried mass weight of paired specimen, oven dried at 100 c¡ for 24h
fresh' mass weight of burn specimen, sample taken right before burn
oven-dried mass weight of burn specimen, oven dried at 100 c¡ for 24
tiller number of each specimen, indicates total numer of tillers each specimen has
height measured at the highest point of each specimen
height measured where 90% biomass concentrated. The cutting point regarding where 90% biomass concentrated is assessed by recorder roughtly
oven-dried mass of unburn specimen from ground level to 10cm above ground
plant width a measured at randomly selected point 1 for 0~10cm height section
plant width a measured at randomly selected point 2 for 0~10cm section
plant width a measured at randomly selected point 3 for 0~10cm section
plant width b measured at randomly selected point 1 for 0~10cm section, which is at the same point 1 where width a taken and b is perpendicular to a
plant width b measured at randomly selected point 2 for 0~10cm section, which is at the same point 2 where width a taken and b is perpendicular to a
plant width b measured at randomly selected point 3 for 0~10cm section, which is at the same point 3 where width a taken and b is perpendicular to a
oven-dried mass of unburn specimen above 10cm height
plant width a measured at randomly selected point 1 for above 10cm height section
plant width a measured at randomly selected point 2 for above 10cm section
plant width a measured at randomly selected point 3 for above 10cm section
plant width b measured at randomly selected point 1 for above 10cm section, which is at the same point 1 where width a taken and b is perpendicular to a
plant width b measured at randomly selected point 2 for above 10cm section, which is at the same point 2 where width a taken and b is perpendicular to a
plant width b measured at randomly selected point 3 for above 10cm section, which is at the same point 3 where width a taken and b is perpendicular to a
